Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( u(t, x) = e^{tA}x \\) where \\( A \\) is a complex matrix. We examine the impact of the integral transformation \\( g(t, x) = \\int_0^t e^{sB}x \\, ds \\), where \\( B \\) is another complex matrix, applied at time zero.

If only \\( u(t, x) \\) is applied to an initial vector \\( x_0 \\) and progressed to time \\( T \\) under the described condition, will the function \\( u(T, x_0) \\) remain unaffected by matrix \\( B \\)?
Explanation: Since only the function \\( u(t, x) \\) involving matrix \\( A \\) is affecting the vector \\( x_0 \\), the outcome at time \\( T \\) will be solely determined by \\( e^{TA}x_0 \\) and independent of matrix \\( B \\). Matrix \\( B \\) is not involved in the transformation or evolution of the system in this scenario.
